description:
Cupriavidus metallidurans is a species of bacteria that belongs to the Betaproteobacteria class. It is a Gram-negative, rod-shaped, and motile bacterium. Cupriavidus metallidurans is known for its remarkable ability to tolerate and resist high concentrations of heavy metals, including copper, cadmium, zinc, and chromium, among others.

This bacterium is commonly found in soil and water environments that are contaminated with heavy metals, and it has evolved various mechanisms to cope with these toxic conditions. Cupriavidus metallidurans possesses a large genome that encodes a wide range of genes responsible for metal resistance, including efflux pumps, metal sequestration, and enzymatic detoxification.

Cupriavidus metallidurans has gained significant attention in the field of bioremediation, as it has the potential to be used in the cleanup of heavy metal-contaminated sites. Additionally, the study of this bacterium's metal resistance mechanisms has contributed to our understanding of bacterial adaptation and survival strategies in extreme environments.
